महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च.translation: The field of activities the body is composed of the five gross elements, the ego, intelligence, the unmanifested, the ten senses, the mind, and the sense objects

मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते सः पापी पापकृत्तमः।.translation: He is called a pretender, a wrongdoer, and a doer of the worst deeds.

यथा नद्यः स्यन्दमानाः समुद्रेऽस्तं गच्छन.translation: As rivers flowing into the ocean disappear, losing their name and form
यथा नद्यः स्यन्दमानाः समुद्रेऽस्तं गच्छन.explanation: Analogy of rivers merging into the ocean

सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जि.translation: The Supersoul appears to have all the senses, yet He is without senses

यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत।.translation: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness, O Bharata, and a rise of unrighteousness, then I manifest Myself.
यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत।.explanation: The divine descends to restore dharma and protect the virtuous.

मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि सन्न्यस्याध्यात्मचेत.translation: Perform all your activities, dedicating them to Me, with full knowledge of Me.
मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि सन्न्यस्याध्यात्मचेत.explanation: Dedicate all actions to the divine with full awareness.

यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्स.translation: He who is satisfied with gain which comes of its own accord, who is free from duality and does not envy, who is steady in both success and failure, is never entangled, although performing actions.
यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्स.explanation: Contentment and freedom from envy are qualities of a realized soul.

कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेत् समाः.translation: While performing works here, one may aspire to live for hundreds of years
कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेत् समाः.explanation: Engage in selfless service for a long, meaningful life

विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भ.translation: Their transformations and the modes of matter are products of material nature
विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भ.explanation: Material nature as the source of transformations and modes

कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मर.translation: One who restrains the senses of action but whose mind dwells on sense objects
कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मर.explanation: such a person is deluded and is called a pretender.
कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मर.source: Hypocrisy arises from controlling actions but dwelling on desires.

पृथिव्यप्तेजोवाय्वाकाशे समुत्थिते पञ्चात.translation: When the five elements earth, water, fire, air, and ether arise in the yoga
पृथिव्यप्तेजोवाय्वाकाशे समुत्थिते पञ्चात.explanation: The elements are part of the yogic experience

जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्.translation: Perceiving the evil of birth, death, old age, disease and lamentation

अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे.translation: Some perceive the Supersoul within themselves through meditation, others through the cultivation of knowledge, and still others through working without desire for fruitive results
अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे.explanation: Different paths to realize the Supersoul

उद्धरेदात्मनाऽऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत्।.translation: One must deliver himself with the help of his mind, and not degrade himself.
उद्धरेदात्मनाऽऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत्।.explanation: Self-improvement is achieved through conscious effort and positive thinking.

अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च।.translation: One who is not envious but is a kind friend to all living entities
अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च।.explanation: who does not think himself a proprietor and is free from false ego
अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च।.source: who is equal in both happiness and distress

तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक् च यद्विकारि यतश्.translation: Now please hear My brief description of this field the body and how its constitution, its changes, its source, its influence, and its purpose
तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक् च यद्विकारि यतश्.explanation: The Lord's promise to describe the field

युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु।.translation: He who is regulated in his habits of eating, sleeping, recreation and work can mitigate all material pains by practicing the yoga system.
युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु।.explanation: Moderation in all aspects of life leads to spiritual advancement.

न तस्य कार्यं करणं च विद्यते न तत्समश्चा.translation: For Him, there is no work to be done, no instrument to be used; no one is seen equal to Him or greater than Him
न तस्य कार्यं करणं च विद्यते न तत्समश्चा.explanation: The divine is beyond action and comparison

त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः।.translation: There are three gates leading to this hell lust, anger, and greed. Every sane man should give these up, for they lead to the degradation of the soul.
त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः।.explanation: Lust, anger, and greed are detrimental to spiritual progress and should be avoided.

मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय।.translation: Just fix your mind upon Me, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, and engage all your intelligence in Me.
मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय।.explanation: Fixing the mind and intelligence on the divine leads to union.

अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः.translation: He who is not dependent on anything, who is pure, expert, impartial, free from all distress

सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः।.translation: The yogi who is ever satisfied, controlling his mind and senses, and is resolute in his determination, whose mind and intelligence are fixed on Me—such a yogi is My devotee and is very dear to Me.
सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः।.explanation: Satisfaction, self-control, and resolve are qualities of a yogi.

ध्यायतो विषयान् पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते।.translation: While contemplating the objects of the senses, a person develops attachment for them.
ध्यायतो विषयान् पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते।.explanation: Attachment arises from dwelling on sensory pleasures.

ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मन.translation: Some perceive the Supersoul within themselves through meditation, others through the cultivation of knowledge, and still others through working without desire for fruitive results
ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मन.explanation: Different paths to realize the Supersoul

न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्।.translation: Without contemplation, there is no peace, and without peace, how can there be happiness?
न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्।.explanation: Peace is essential for happiness, and it comes from contemplation.

इन्द्रियाणि हयानाहुर्विषयां स्तेषु गोचरा.translation: The senses, they say, are the horses; the objects of sense, what they range over
इन्द्रियाणि हयानाहुर्विषयां स्तेषु गोचरा.explanation: The senses are like horses pulling the chariot

समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः.translation: One who is equal to friends and enemies, who is equipoised in honor and dishonor, heat and cold, happiness and distress, fame and infamy

क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्.translation: From anger arises delusion, and from delusion, confusion of memory.
क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्.explanation: Anger leads to clouded judgment and loss of clarity.

विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि.translation: Living in a secluded place, detachment from the general mass of people

मय्यार्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्.translation: Such a devotee of Mine is very dear to Me
मय्यार्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्.explanation: The Lord's declaration of love for such a devotee

पूर्णस्य पूर्णमादाय पूर्णमेवावशिष्यते.translation: Taking fullness from fullness, fullness still remains
पूर्णस्य पूर्णमादाय पूर्णमेवावशिष्यते.explanation: Completeness remains even after taking away

ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्प.translation: But those who, renouncing all their activities unto Me, and being fully devoted to Me, worship Me with undeviated mind, meditating on Me—for them I am the swift deliverer from the ocean of birth and death.
ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्प.explanation: Renouncing actions to the divine is a path to devotion.

सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान् विद्धि नष्टानचेतस.translation: Those who, out of envy, disregard these teachings and do not follow them regularly, are to be considered bereft of all knowledge, befooled, and ruined in their endeavors.
सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान् विद्धि नष्टानचेतस.explanation: Lack of knowledge and foolishness lead to ruin.

तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः।.translation: Therefore, O mighty-armed, one whose senses are completely restrained from their objects is a person of steady wisdom.
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः।.explanation: Restraint of the senses is a sign of a person with steady wisdom.

वेदान्तविज्ञानसुनिश्चितार्थाः संन्यासयोग.translation: Those who have ascertained the meaning of Vedanta and are well-established in knowledge, having purified their being through renunciation

अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते.translation: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds; everything emanates from Me.
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते.explanation: The divine is the origin of all creation.

य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह.translation: One who understands this philosophy concerning material nature, the living entity, and the interaction of the modes of nature is sure to attain liberation
य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह.explanation: Understanding this philosophy leads to liberation

ब्रह्मविदाप्नोति परम्.translation: The knower of Brahman attains the Supreme
ब्रह्मविदाप्नोति परम्.explanation: Knowledge of Brahman leads to the Supreme

बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च.translation: He is outside and inside of all living beings, and is moving and not moving

ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तन्ते कामकारत.translation: He who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own whims attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme destination.
ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तन्ते कामकारत.explanation: Ignoring scriptures and acting whimsically leads to undesirable outcomes.

प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्.translation: Living entities follow their nature. What can repression accomplish?

शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः.translation: Who is always free from contamination, always silent and content with anything, who does not care for any residence, who is fixed in knowledge, and who is engaged in devotional service

सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः।.translation: He who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, never becomes separated from Me.
सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः।.explanation: Seeing the divine in all beings leads to unity consciousness.

श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर.translation: Those who execute their duties according to My injunctions and who follow this teaching faithfully, being freed from envy, are released from the bondage of fruitive actions.
श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर.explanation: Faith and freedom from envy lead to liberation.

तमसो मा ज्योतिर्गमय.translation: Lead us from darkness to Light

सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रि.translation: Such a devotee of Mine is very dear to Me
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रि.explanation: The Lord's declaration of love for such a devotee

यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च.translation: He by whom no one is put into difficulty and who is not disturbed by anyone, who is equipoised in happiness and distress, fear and anxiety

इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्.translation: There are principles to regulate attachment and aversion pertaining to the senses and their objects.
इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्.explanation: Attachment and aversion are regulated by the senses.

श्रेयान् स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात् स्वनु.translation: It is better to engage in ones own occupation, even though one may perform it imperfectly, than to accept anothers occupation and perform it perfectly.
श्रेयान् स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात् स्वनु.explanation: Following ones own dharma is more beneficial than perfectly following anothers.

मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी.translation: Steady and unalloyed devotion to Me

ईशा वास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत.translation: All this whatever exists in the universe should be covered by the Lord
ईशा वास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत.explanation: Everything belongs to the divine; detachment is key

ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक्.translation: This knowledge of the field and the knower of the field has been described by various sages in various Vedic writings
ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक्.explanation: References to the sources of this knowledge

येनाक्रमन्त्यृषयो ह्याप्तकामा यत्र तत् स.translation: By which the seers, with desires fulfilled, ascend to where is that supreme abode of Truth
येनाक्रमन्त्यृषयो ह्याप्तकामा यत्र तत् स.explanation: Ascension to the abode of Truth

ॐ शान्तिः शान्तिः शान्तिः.explanation: Invocation of peace at all levels

अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम्.translation: Although He is situated as one, He is divided into countless beings

ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य वि.translation: He is the knowledge, He is the object of knowledge, and He is the goal of knowledge
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य वि.explanation: Supersoul as the embodiment of knowledge

वेदाहमेतं पुरुषं महान्तमादित्यवर्णं तमसः.translation: I have realized this Great Being who shines like the sun beyond darkness
वेदाहमेतं पुरुषं महान्तमादित्यवर्णं तमसः.explanation: Realization of the Great Being transcends darkness

विज्ञानवान् भवति युक्तेन मनसा सदा.translation: He who is discriminating, with his mind ever collected

इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते।.translation: When the mind is closely attached to the wandering senses, it carries away ones discrimination as a wind carries away a boat on the sea.
इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते।.explanation: A mind attached to the senses can distract one from their path, like a windblown boat.

न कर्मणा न प्रजया धनेन त्यागेनैके अमृतत्.translation: Neither by work, nor by progeny, nor by wealth, but by renunciation alone have some attained immortality
न कर्मणा न प्रजया धनेन त्यागेनैके अमृतत्.explanation: Renunciation as a path to immortality

परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः.translation: He is described as the Supersoul, situated in the body, and He is the proprietor of the body

एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति.translation: Those who are knowers of the truth declare that one who knows the field is the knower of the field
एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति.explanation: Importance of knowing the field and the knower of the field

इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते.translation: This body, O son of Kunti, is called the field, and one who knows this body is called the knower of the field
इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते.explanation: Definition of the field (body) and the knower of the field (soul)

ते ब्रह्मलोके तु परान्तकाले परामृताः परि.translation: These knowers of Brahman attain the supreme immortal Brahman and are freed from the cycle of rebirth.
ते ब्रह्मलोके तु परान्तकाले परामृताः परि.explanation: Liberation at the end of time

सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवान.translation: Even a man of knowledge acts according to his own nature.
सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवान.explanation: Actions are influenced by ones inherent nature.

या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी.translation: What is night for all beings, the disciplined one is awake in that; and what is the waking state for all beings, that is night for the sage who sees.
या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी.explanation: The wise are awake to the true reality while others are asleep to it, and vice versa.

यस्य ब्रह्म च क्षत्रं च उभे भवत ओदनः.translation: For whom the Brahmanas and Kshatriyas both become food
यस्य ब्रह्म च क्षत्रं च उभे भवत ओदनः.explanation: All are subject to the divine will

कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन।.translation: You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन।.explanation: Focus on the present action without worrying about the outcome. Detachment from results is key.

वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः।.translation: Being freed from attachment, fear and anger, fully absorbed in Me, taking refuge in Me, and purified by the knowledge of Me, many have attained My divine nature.
वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः।.explanation: Liberation is attained by overcoming negative emotions and surrendering to the divine.

यस्त्वविज्ञानवान् भवत्ययुक्तेन मनसा सदा.translation: He who is without discrimination, with his mind ever uncollected
यस्त्वविज्ञानवान् भवत्ययुक्तेन मनसा सदा.explanation: Lack of discrimination leads to bondage

अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः.translation: That person who follows this imperishable path of devotional service and who completely engages himself with faith, making Me the supreme goal, is very dear to Me
अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः.explanation: The Lord's final declaration about His beloved devotee

यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन.translation: But he who controls the senses by the mind and engages his active organs in working without attachment
यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन.source: Controlling senses with the mind and working without attachment is superior.

अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्.translation: If you cannot fix your mind upon Me without deviation
अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्.explanation: then follow the regulative principles of bhakti-yoga. In this way develop a desire to attain Me.
अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्.source: If unable to fix the mind, follow the regulative principles of bhakti-yoga.

स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्.translation: From confusion of memory, the intellect is ruined, and when the intellect is ruined, one perishes.
स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्.explanation: Loss of memory leads to the ruin of intellect and ultimately to destruction.

अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपास.translation: Again there are those who, although not conversant in spiritual knowledge, begin to worship the Supreme Person upon hearing about Him from others
अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपास.explanation: Worship based on hearing from others

सर्वधर्मान् परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज।.translation: Abandon all varieties of dharma and simply surrender unto Me alone.
सर्वधर्मान् परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज।.explanation: Complete surrender to the divine is the ultimate path to liberation.

समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम्।.translation: One who sees the Supreme Lord equally present in all living beings

निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी.translation: Who is equal in both happiness and distress, who is forgiving, ever content, and self-controlled

ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृत.translation: I shall now explain the knowable, knowing which you will taste the eternal
ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृत.explanation: The Lords promise to explain the knowable

कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु.translation: This is due to his association with that material nature
कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु.explanation: Association with material nature as the cause of repeated births

सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति.translation: In this way the Supersoul exists, pervading everything

आत्मानं रथिनं विद्धि शरीरं रथमेव तु.translation: Know the Self as the rider in the chariot, and the body as the chariot
आत्मानं रथिनं विद्धि शरीरं रथमेव तु.explanation: Analogy of the chariot to understand the self

वायुरनिलममृतमथेदं भस्मान्तं शरीरम्.translation: May my life-breath merge with the immortal cosmic breath, and may this body be reduced to ashes
वायुरनिलममृतमथेदं भस्मान्तं शरीरम्.explanation: Prayer for union with the divine at death

हिरण्मयेन पात्रेण सत्यस्यापिहितं मुखम्.translation: The face of Truth is covered with a golden disc
हिरण्मयेन पात्रेण सत्यस्यापिहितं मुखम्.explanation: Truth is often hidden by illusions

अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासत.translation: Those who always think of Me and worship Me with exclusive devotion

तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत् तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ।.translation: One should not come under the control of such attachment and aversion, because they are stumbling blocks on the path of self-realization.

न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते।.translation: Verily, there is no purifier in this world like knowledge.
न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते।.explanation: Knowledge is the ultimate means of purification and self-realization.

अशब्दमस्पर्शमरूपमव्ययं तथाऽरसं नित्यमगन्.translation: That which is soundless, touchless, formless, undecaying, and also tasteless, eternal, and odorless

श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं व.translation: If you cannot take to this practice, then engage yourself in the cultivation of knowledge.
श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं व.explanation: Knowledge is superior to mechanical practice, and meditation is superior to knowledge.

तेने त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्य स्वि.translation: Protect yourself through renunciation. Do not covet the wealth of anyone
तेने त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्य स्वि.explanation: Renounce desires and avoid greed for true freedom

ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यह.translation: In whatever way people surrender to Me, I reciprocate with them accordingly.
ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यह.explanation: The divine responds to the devotee's level of surrender and devotion.

अद्वेष्टृ सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च.translation: One who is not envious but is a kind friend to all living entities, who has no sense of ownership, and is free from false ego

भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्ण.translation: He is the maintainer of every living entity, and He annihilates and creates all

योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ.translation: Perform your duties established in yoga, O Dhananjaya, abandoning attachment.
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ.explanation: Yoga is the path to perform actions without attachment, leading to liberation.

क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं.translation: Knowledge of the field and the knower of the field is considered by Me to be true knowledge
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं.explanation: The ultimate knowledge according to the Lord

उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः.translation: However, there is another transcendental enjoyer who is the Lord
उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः.explanation: The Lord as the supreme enjoyer

कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः शरीरयात्रापि च ते.translation: Work is better than no work. Even the bare maintenance of your body would not be possible without work.
कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः शरीरयात्रापि च ते.explanation: Work is necessary for sustenance and spiritual growth.

सत्यमेव जयते नानृतं सत्येन पन्था विततो द.translation: Truth alone triumphs, not falsehood; through truth lies the path to the divine

ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते।.translation: While contemplating the objects of the senses, a person develops attachment for them.
ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते।.explanation: Attachment arises from dwelling on sensory pleasures.

आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन.translation: As the ocean, though constantly filled by rivers, remains unmoved, similarly, the sage who remains unmoved despite the flow of desires around him attains peace, and not the man who strives to fulfill such desires.
आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन.explanation: One who remains undisturbed by desires, like the ocean, attains peace.

सर्वे भद्राणि पश्यन्तु मा कश्चिद्दुःखभाग.translation: May all see what is auspicious, may no one suffer

मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु।.translation: Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me.
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु।.explanation: Directing the mind towards the divine through devotion and worship leads to union.

एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य.translation: This is the Brahmic state, O Arjuna, attaining to this, one is never deluded.
एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य.explanation: The Brahmic state is one of enlightenment, free from delusion.

तथा विद्वान् नामरूपाद् विमुक्तः परात्परं.translation: So the wise one, freed from name and form, attains the supreme divine Person
तथा विद्वान् नामरूपाद् विमुक्तः परात्परं.explanation: Freedom from name and form leads to the divine

पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यत.translation: The living entity, thus situated in material nature, enjoys the modes of nature, and this is the cause of his various sufferings and enjoyments
पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यत.explanation: Living entitys role in experiencing sufferings and enjoyments

पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रय.translation: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit or water, I will accept it.
पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रय.explanation: Sincere devotion is the key, not the material offering.

स्थित्वाऽस्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृ.translation: Being established in this state even at the end of life, one attains Brahmanirvana oneness with Brahman.
स्थित्वाऽस्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृ.explanation: Attaining the Brahmic state, even at the time of death, leads to liberation.

सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके.translation: Because of His being subtle, He is beyond the power of the material senses to see or to know

तत् त्वं असि.explanation: You are one with the divine

परास्य शक्तिर्विविधैव श्रूयते स्वाभाविकी.translation: His supreme power is revealed in various ways; His knowledge, strength, and action are natural to Him
परास्य शक्तिर्विविधैव श्रूयते स्वाभाविकी.explanation: The divine power is diverse and natural

न तत्र सूर्यो भाति न चन्द्रतारकं नेमा वि.translation: There the sun does not shine, nor do the moon and stars, nor do these lightnings shine. How then could this fire?
न तत्र सूर्यो भाति न चन्द्रतारकं नेमा वि.explanation: The divine light transcends all other lights

प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते।.translation: In that serenity, all miseries come to an end, for the intellect of such a person of serene mind soon becomes steady.
प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते।.explanation: A serene mind is free from suffering, and the intellect becomes stable.

तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात्।.translation: I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death.
तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात्।.explanation: The divine rescues those who are devoted.

ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते.translation: He is the source of light in all luminous objects
ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते.explanation: Supersoul as the source of all light

इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृ.translation: Desire, hatred, happiness, distress, the aggregate, the life symptoms, and convictions all these are considered, in summary, to be the field of activities and its interactions

तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन के.translation: Who is equal in praise and reproach, who speaks little, who is satisfied with whatever comes, who is not attached to his home

न जायते म्रियते वा विपश्चित्.translation: The wise man is neither born nor does he die

इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं सम.translation: Thus the field of activities, knowledge, and the knowable have been summarily described by Me

सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ।.translation: Treating alike happiness and distress, gain and loss, victory and defeat, engage yourself in battle. Thus you will not incur sin.
सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ।.explanation: Equanimity in all circumstances is essential for spiritual progress.

सत्यं ज्ञानमनन्तं ब्रह्म.translation: Brahman is Truth, Knowledge, and Infinity

ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम.translation: But those who, out of envy, disregard these teachings and do not follow them regularly, are to be considered bereft of all knowledge, befooled, and ruined in their endeavors.
ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम.explanation: Envy and disregard for divine teachings lead to ignorance.

अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव।.translation: If you cannot practice the regulations of bhakti-yoga, then just try to work for Me.
अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव।.explanation: Working for the divine is another path if regulation is difficult.

ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चित.translation: And it is especially presented in Vedanta-sutra with all reasoning as to cause and effect
ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चित.explanation: Emphasis on Vedanta-sutra as a source of this knowledge

अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते.translation: This knowable is without beginning, is beyond Me, and is beyond both cause and effect

ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः।.translation: Those who execute their duties according to My injunctions and who follow this teaching faithfully
ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः।.source: become free from the bondage of fruitive actions.

सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामक्रोधोऽभिजायते।.translation: From attachment, desire arises, and from desire, anger springs forth.
सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामक्रोधोऽभिजायते।.explanation: Attachment leads to desire, which in turn can manifest as anger.

नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु.translation: Equanimity in the face of desirable and undesirable events

नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावन.translation: One whose mind and senses are not controlled can neither have the intellect nor steady contemplation.
नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावन.explanation: Without control over the mind and senses, neither intellect nor contemplation is possible.

कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते.translation: Nature is said to be the cause of all material activities and effects, whereas the living entity is the cause of the various sufferings and enjoyments in this world
कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते.explanation: Roles of nature and the living entity

विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निस्पृ.translation: The person who has abandoned all desires and moves without longing, devoid of the sense of "I" and "mine" attains peace.
विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निस्पृ.explanation: Freedom from desires and ego leads to peace.

हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्र.translation: Such a devotee is very dear to Me
हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्र.explanation: The Lord's declaration of love for such a devotee

अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः।.translation: If, however, you are unable to work in this consciousness of Me, then try to act giving up all results of your work and try to be self-situated.
अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः।.explanation: If unable to work for the divine, renounce the results of your actions.

मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते.translation: Only My devotees can understand this thoroughly and thus attain to My nature
मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते.explanation: Devotion as the key to understanding these topics

असतो मा सद्गमय.translation: Lead us from the unreal to the Real

श्रद्धावान् लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्.translation: The faithful, who are devoted to acquiring knowledge and who have subdued their senses, achieve enlightenment.
श्रद्धावान् लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्.explanation: Faith, devotion, and self-control are essential for attaining true knowledge.

प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि.translation: Material nature and the living entities should be understood as beginningless
प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि.explanation: Beginningless nature of matter and spirit

असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु.translation: Nonattachment, being free from entanglement with children, wife, home and the rest

स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे श्रृणु.translation: And also of the knower of the field and his influence
स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे श्रृणु.explanation: The Lord's promise to describe the knower of the field

अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान्.translation: O Agni, lead us on the right path to prosperity

तं ह देवमात्मबुद्धिप्रकाशं मुमुक्षुर्वै.translation: I, seeking liberation, take refuge in that God, who reveals Himself through the light of ones own intellect
तं ह देवमात्मबुद्धिप्रकाशं मुमुक्षुर्वै.explanation: Taking refuge in the divine for liberation

आनन्दो ब्रह्मेति व्यजानात्.translation: He realized that Brahman is Bliss

परेण नाकं निहितं गुहायां विभ्राजते यद्यत.translation: Supreme is that blissful state, hidden in the cave of the heart, where the aspirants enter
परेण नाकं निहितं गुहायां विभ्राजते यद्यत.explanation: The heart as the cave of the divine

असतो मा सद्गमय तमसो मा ज्योतिर्गमय मृत्य.translation: Lead us from the unreal to the Real, from darkness to Light, from death to Immortality
असतो मा सद्गमय तमसो मा ज्योतिर्गमय मृत्य.explanation: This is a prayer for enlightenment and self-realization, seeking to transcend limitations

असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च.translation: He is unattached, although He is the maintainer of all, and He is transcendental to the modes of nature, although He is the master of them

रागद्वेषविमुक्तेस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चर.translation: But by controlling the mind, and without attachment or aversion, even while enjoying sense objects, one attains grace.
रागद्वेषविमुक्तेस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चर.explanation: Detachment from likes and dislikes, even while engaging with the senses, leads to inner peace.

क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रे.translation: Know that I am also the knower of the field in all fields, O Bharata
क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रे.explanation: The Lord's declaration of being the knower of all fields

ॐ सह नाववतु सह नौ भुनक्तु.translation: Om, may He protect us both, may He nourish us both
ॐ सह नाववतु सह नौ भुनक्तु.explanation: Prayer for mutual protection and nourishment

यो ब्रह्माणं विद्धाति पूर्वं यो वै वेदां.translation: He who creates Brahma first and delivers the Vedas to him
यो ब्रह्माणं विद्धाति पूर्वं यो वै वेदां.explanation: The divine is the source of Brahma and the Vedas

सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते.translation: He will not take birth here again, regardless of his present situation

यदात्मतत्त्वेन तु ब्रह्मतत्त्वं दीपोपमेन.translation: When one realizes the truth of Brahman with the help of the Atman, like a lamp
यदात्मतत्त्वेन तु ब्रह्मतत्त्वं दीपोपमेन.explanation: Realization of Brahman through the Atman

तमेव भान्तमनुभाति सर्वं तस्य भासा सर्वमि.translation: Everything shines after Him; by His light, all this is illuminated
तमेव भान्तमनुभाति सर्वं तस्य भासा सर्वमि.explanation: Everything is illuminated by the divine light

तमेव विदित्वातिमृत्युमेति नान्यः पन्था व.translation: Only by knowing Him does one pass over death; there is no other way to reach the Supreme Goal
तमेव विदित्वातिमृत्युमेति नान्यः पन्था व.explanation: Knowing Him (the divine) leads to immortality

यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्.translation: One who neither rejoices nor grieves, who neither laments nor desires, and who renounces both auspicious and inauspicious things

पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजा.translation: The living entity, thus situated in material nature, enjoys the modes of nature
पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजा.explanation: Living entitys interaction with the modes of nature

स विश्वकृद्विश्वविदात्मा योनिः सर्वस्य.translation: He is the maker of all, the knower of all, the Self, and the source of everything
स विश्वकृद्विश्वविदात्मा योनिः सर्वस्य.explanation: The divine is the source of creation

एको वशी निष्क्रियाणाम् बहुनाम् एकं बीजं.translation: He is the one controller, inactive, the one seed that multiplies in many ways
एको वशी निष्क्रियाणाम् बहुनाम् एकं बीजं.explanation: The divine is the controller and source of multiplicity

शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान् यः स मे प्रिय.translation: Such a devotee is very dear to Me
शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान् यः स मे प्रिय.explanation: The Lord's declaration of love for such a devotee

एको देवः सर्वभूतेषु गूढः सर्वव्यापी सर्व.translation: The one God is hidden in all beings, all-pervading, the Self of all beings
एको देवः सर्वभूतेषु गूढः सर्वव्यापी सर्व.explanation: The divine is immanent and transcendent

पूषन्नेकर्षे यम सूर्य प्राजापत्य व्यूह र.translation: O Sun, gather Your light, withdraw Your rays, may I see Your blessed form
पूषन्नेकर्षे यम सूर्य प्राजापत्य व्यूह र.explanation: Prayer to see the divine essence

अन्धं तमः प्रविशन्ति ये के चात्महनो जनाः.translation: Into blinding darkness enter those who worship ignorance

मृत्योर्मा अमृतं गमय.translation: Lead us from death to Immortality

इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च.translation: Renunciation of the objects of sense gratification, absence of false ego

मा विद्विषावहै ॐ शान्तिः शान्तिः शान्तिः.translation: May we not hate each other, Om Peace, Peace, Peace
मा विद्विषावहै ॐ शान्तिः शान्तिः शान्तिः.explanation: Prayer against hatred and for peace

आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः.translation: Approaching a bona fide spiritual master, cleanliness, steadiness, self-control

सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः.translation: Who is always content, who is self-controlled, and whose determination is firm, whose mind and intelligence are engaged in Me

सर्वे भवन्तु सुखिनः सर्वे सन्तु निरामयाः.translation: May all be happy, may all be free from illness
सर्वे भवन्तु सुखिनः सर्वे सन्तु निरामयाः.explanation: Universal prayer for happiness and health

यदा सर्वे प्रमुच्यन्ते कामा येऽस्य हृदि.translation: When all desires dwelling in the heart cease
यदा सर्वे प्रमुच्यन्ते कामा येऽस्य हृदि.explanation: Liberation from desires leads to immortality

सह वीर्यं करवावहै तेजस्वि नावधीतमस्तु.translation: May we acquire strength together, may our learning be brilliant
सह वीर्यं करवावहै तेजस्वि नावधीतमस्तु.explanation: Prayer for strength and brilliance in learning

विद्यां चाविद्यां च यस्तद्वेदोभयं सह.translation: He who knows both knowledge and ignorance together
विद्यां चाविद्यां च यस्तद्वेदोभयं सह.explanation: Balance knowledge and practical wisdom for enlightenment

उत्थानवत जाग्रत प्राप्य वरान्निबोधत.translation: Arise, awake, and learn by approaching the wise

एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा.translation: All this I have briefly described is knowledge, and besides this whatever there may be is ignorance

तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्.translation: Therefore, let the scriptures be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done.
तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्.explanation: The scriptures provide guidance on righteous conduct and moral duties.

अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर.translation: Constancy in the knowledge of the self, and philosophical search for the Absolute Truth

सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्.translation: Everywhere are Its hands and legs, Its eyes, heads and faces, and It has ears everywhere

अणोरणीयान् महतो महीयानात्मा.translation: The Self is smaller than the small, greater than the great

तमसो हि परं ज्योतिः.explanation: The goal is to transcend darkness and reach the light

ऊर्ध्वमूलोऽवाक्शाख एषोऽश्वत्थः सनातनः.translation: With roots upward and branches downward is this ancient banyan tree

पूर्णमदः पूर्णमिदं पूर्णात् पूर्णमुदच्यत.translation: That (Brahman) is whole, this (the universe) is whole; from the whole (Brahman) the whole (the universe) arises

यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम्।.translation: From wherever the mind wanders due to its flickering and unsteady nature
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम्।.explanation: one must certainly withdraw it and bring it back under the control of the Self.
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम्।.source: Controlling the wandering mind is crucial for meditation.

इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः.translation: And also the five sense objects, desire, hatred, happiness, distress, the aggregate, the life symptoms, and convictions all these are considered, in summary, to be the field of activities and its interactions

न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपा.translation: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor in the future shall any of us cease to be.
न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपा.explanation: The eternal nature of the soul

देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा।.translation: As the embodied soul continuously passes, in this body, from boyhood to youth to old age, the soul similarly passes into another body at death. A sober person is not bewildered by such a change.
देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा।.explanation: The soul transmigrates through different bodies

मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःख.translation: O son of Kunti, the contact between the senses and the sense objects gives rise to fleeting perceptions of happiness and distress. These are non-permanent, and come and go like the winter and summer seasons. O descendent of Bharata, one must learn to tolerate them without being disturbed.

यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ।.translation: O best among men, the person who is not disturbed by happiness and distress, and remains steady in both, becomes eligible for liberation.

नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः।.translation: Of the non-existent there is no endurance, and of the existent there is no cessation.

अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्।.translation: Know that which pervades the entire body is indestructible. No one is able to destroy the imperishable soul.
अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्।.explanation: The indestructible nature of the soul

अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः.translation: The material body of the indestructible, immeasurable and eternal living entity is sure to come to an end; therefore, fight, O descendent of Bharata.
अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः.explanation: The body is temporary but the soul is eternal

य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम्.translation: Neither he who thinks the living entity is the slayer nor he who thinks it is slain is in knowledge, for the self slays not nor is slain.

न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिन्नायं भूत्वा भव.translation: The soul is never born nor dies. Nor does it exist after coming into being. It is unborn, eternal, ever-existing, and primeval. It is not slain when the body is slain.
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिन्नायं भूत्वा भव.explanation: The eternal and unchanging nature of the soul

वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम्। कथं स.translation: O Partha, how can a person who knows that the soul is indestructible, eternal, unborn and immutable kill anyone or cause anyone to kill?

वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णात.translation: As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul similarly accepts new material bodies, giving up the old and useless ones.
वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णात.explanation: The soul changes bodies like clothes

नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः.translation: The soul can never be cut to pieces by any weapon, nor burned by fire, nor moistened by water, nor withered by the wind.
नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः.explanation: The soul is indestructible by material elements

अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च.translation: This individual soul is unbreakable and insoluble, and can be neither burned nor dried. He is everlasting, present everywhere, unchangeable, immovable and eternally the same.
अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च.explanation: The eternal qualities of the soul

अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते।.translation: It is said that the soul is invisible, inconceivable and immutable. Knowing this, you should not grieve for the body.

अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम्.translation: If, however, you think that the soul is perpetually born and always dies, still you still have no reason to lament, O mighty-armed.
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम्.explanation: Even if the soul were mortal
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम्.source: there is no cause for grief

जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृत.translation: For one who has taken his birth, death is certain; and for one who is dead, birth is certain. Therefore, in the unavoidable discharge of your duty, you should not lament.
जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृत.explanation: Death and birth are natural cycles

अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत।.translation: All created beings are unmanifest in their beginning, manifest in their interim state, and unmanifest again when annihilated. So what need is there for lamentation?
अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत।.explanation: All beings follow the cycle of manifestation

आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति.translation: Some look at the soul as amazing, some describe him as amazing, and some hear of him as amazing, while others, even after hearing about him, cannot understand him at all.
आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति.explanation: The soul is wondrous and difficult to comprehend

देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत। त.translation: O descendant of Bharata, he who dwells in the body can never be slain. Therefore you need not grieve for any living being.
देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत। त.explanation: The soul within the body is eternal

स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि।.translation: Considering your specific duty as a kshatriya, you should know that there is no better engagement for you than fighting on religious principles; and so there is no need for hesitation.
स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि।.explanation: Duty must be performed according to one's nature

यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम्। स.translation: O Partha, happy are the kshatriyas to whom such fighting opportunities come unsought, opening for them the doors of the heavenly planets.
यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम्। स.explanation: Fighting for righteousness opens doors to higher realms

अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्य.translation: If, however, you do not perform your fighting duty, you will certainly incur sins for neglecting your duties and thus lose your reputation as a fighter.
अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्य.explanation: Neglecting duty leads to sin and loss of reputation

अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्यय.translation: People will always speak of your infamy, and for a respectable person, dishonor is worse than death.
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्यय.explanation: Dishonor is worse than death for the honorable

भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः।.translation: The great generals who have highly esteemed your name and fame will think that you have left the battlefield out of fear only, and thus they will consider you a coward.

अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः।.translation: Your enemies will describe you in many unkind words and scorn your ability. What could be more painful for you?

हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक.translation: O son of Kunti, either you will be killed on the battlefield and attain the heavenly planets, or you will conquer and enjoy the earthly kingdom. Therefore, get up with determination and fight.

योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ.translation: Be steadfast in yoga, O Arjuna. Perform your duty and abandon all attachment to success or failure. Such evenness of mind is called yoga.
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ.explanation: Yoga is equanimity in success and failure

दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय। बु.translation: O Dhananjaya, keep all abominable activities far distant by devotional service, and in that consciousness surrender unto the Lord. Those who want to enjoy the fruits of their work are misers.
दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय। बु.explanation: Devotional service is superior to fruitive work

बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते। त.translation: A man engaged in devotional service rids himself of both good and bad actions even in this life. Therefore strive for yoga, which is the art of all work.
बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते। त.explanation: Yoga is the art of working skillfully

कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनी.translation: By thus engaging in devotional service to the Lord, great sages or devotees free themselves from the results of work in the material world. In this way they become free from the cycle of birth and death and attain the state beyond all miseries.
कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनी.explanation: Devotional service frees one from material bondage

यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति। त.translation: When your intelligence has passed out of the dense forest of delusion, you shall become indifferent to all that has been heard and all that is to be heard.

श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्.translation: When your mind is no longer disturbed by the flowery language of the Vedas, and when it remains fixed in the trance of self-realization, then you will have attained the divine consciousness.
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्.explanation: Steady intelligence leads to divine consciousness

अर्जुन उवाच। स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाध.translation: Arjuna said: O Keshava, what are the symptoms of one whose consciousness is thus merged in transcendence? How does he speak, and what is his language? How does he sit, and how does he walk?
अर्जुन उवाच। स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाध.explanation: Arjuna asks about the characteristics of a self-realized person

श्रीभगवानुवाच। प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, when a man gives up all varieties of desire for sense gratification, which arise from mental concoction, and when his mind, thus purified, finds satisfaction in the self alone, then he is said to be in pure transcendental consciousness.
श्रीभगवानुवाच। प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान.explanation: A person in pure consciousness finds satisfaction in the self

दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः।.translation: One whose mind is undisturbed in the midst of sorrows and who is free from eager desire amidst pleasures, who is free from attachment, fear and anger, is called a sage of steady mind.
दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः।.explanation: A sage remains steady in all circumstances

यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाश.translation: One who is not attached to anything, who neither rejoices upon achieving something good nor laments upon obtaining something bad, is firmly fixed in perfect knowledge.

यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः। इ.translation: When one withdraws his senses from the sense objects, as a tortoise withdraws its limbs into its shell, his intelligence becomes steady.
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः। इ.explanation: Withdrawing senses leads to steady intelligence

विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः। रस.translation: The embodied soul may be restricted from sense enjoyment, though the taste for sense objects remains. But, experiencing a higher taste, he is fixed in consciousness.
विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः। रस.explanation: Higher taste leads to steady consciousness

यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः। इ.translation: The senses are so strong and impetuous, O Arjuna, that they forcibly carry away the mind even of a man of discrimination who is endeavoring to control them.
यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः। इ.explanation: The senses can overpower even the wise

तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः। व.translation: One who restrains his senses, keeping them under full control, and fixes his consciousness upon Me, is known as a man of steady intelligence.
तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः। व.explanation: Controlling senses and fixing consciousness on the divine

सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायत.translation: From attachment, desire develops; from desire, anger arises. From anger, delusion follows; from delusion, bewilderment of memory. When memory is bewildered, intelligence is lost; and when intelligence is lost, one falls down again into the material pool.
सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायत.explanation: The chain of attachment leading to downfall

रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चर.translation: One who can control his senses by practicing the regulative principles of freedom from desires, anger and fear, can alone become a saintly person and thus be able to control his mind.

प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते। प्.translation: For one who is so situated in the Divine consciousness, the threefold miseries of material existence exist no longer; in such a happy state, one's intelligence soon becomes steady.

नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावन.translation: One who is not connected with the Supreme can have neither transcendental intelligence nor a steady mind, without which there is no possibility of peace. And how can there be any happiness without peace?

इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते।.translation: As a boat on the water is swept away by a strong wind, even one of the senses on which the mind focuses can carry away a man's intelligence.
इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते।.explanation: The mind attached to senses loses discrimination

तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः। इ.translation: Therefore, O mighty-armed, one whose senses are completely restrained from their objects is certainly of steady intelligence.
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः। इ.explanation: Complete sense control leads to steady intelligence

या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी.translation: What is night for all beings is the time of awakening for the self-controlled; and the time of awakening for all beings is night for the introspective sage.
या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी.explanation: The wise are awake when others sleep

आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन.translation: A person who is not disturbed by the incessant flow of desires—that enter like rivers into the ocean, which is ever being filled but is always still—can alone achieve peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy such desires.
आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन.explanation: The ocean remains calm despite rivers flowing into it

विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्प.translation: A person who has given up all desires for sense gratification, who lives free from desires, who has given up all sense of proprietorship and is devoid of false ego—he alone can attain real peace.
विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्प.explanation: Freedom from desires leads to peace

एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य.translation: That is the way of the spiritual and godly life, after attaining which a man is not bewildered. If one is thus situated even at the hour of death, one can enter into the kingdom of God.
एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य.explanation: The path of spiritual life leads to liberation

सन्न्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदित.translation: Arjuna said: O mighty-armed one, I wish to understand the purpose of renunciation and the purpose of renounced order of life, and the difference between them.

श्रीभगवानुवाच। सन्न्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश.translation: The Blessed Lord said: The renunciation of work and work in devotion are both good for liberation. But, of the two, work in devotional service is better than renunciation of work.
श्रीभगवानुवाच। सन्न्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश.explanation: Work in devotion is superior to renunciation

ज्ञेयः स नित्यसन्न्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न.translation: One who neither hates nor desires the fruits of his activities is known to be always renounced. Such a person, free from all dualities, easily overcomes material bondage and is completely liberated, O mighty-armed Arjuna.
ज्ञेयः स नित्यसन्न्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न.explanation: Renunciation means freedom from attachment and aversion

साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डि.translation: Only the ignorant speak of devotional service as being different from the analytical study of the material world. Those who are actually learned say that he who applies himself well to one of these paths achieves the results of both.
साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डि.explanation: The wise see unity in different paths

यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि.translation: One who knows that the position reached by means of analytical study can also be attained by devotional service, and who therefore sees analytical study and devotional service to be on the same level, sees things as they are.
यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि.explanation: Both paths lead to the same goal

सन्न्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः। य.translation: Merely renouncing all activities yet not engaging in the service of the Lord will not lead to liberation. But one who engages in devotional service, without expectation of profit, can achieve the Supreme.
सन्न्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः। य.explanation: Devotional service is essential for liberation

योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्.translation: One who works in devotion, who is a pure soul, and who controls his mind and senses, is dear to everyone, and everyone is dear to him. Though always working, such a man is never entangled.

नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्व.translation: A person in the divine consciousness, although engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving about, sleeping and breathing, always knows within himself that he actually does nothing at all.
नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्व.explanation: The self-realized person acts without attachment

प्रलपन्विषजन्दृष्ट्वा मोक्षयन्निन्द्रिया.translation: Because he knows that only the material senses are engaged with the objects of the senses, and he is aloof from such engagement, he is not bound by the reactions of sense activities.
प्रलपन्विषजन्दृष्ट्वा मोक्षयन्निन्द्रिया.explanation: Detachment from sense activities brings freedom

ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा कर.translation: One who performs his duty without attachment, surrendering the results unto the Supreme Lord, is unaffected by sinful action, as the lotus leaf is untouched by water.
ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा कर.explanation: Working without attachment is like a lotus in water

कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि।.translation: The yogis, abandoning attachment, act with body, mind, intelligence and even with the senses, only for the purpose of purification.

युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति.translation: The steadily devoted soul attains unadulterated peace because he offers the result of all activities to Me; whereas a person who is not in union with the Divine, who is greedy for the fruits of his labor, becomes entangled.
युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति.explanation: Offering results to the divine brings peace

सर्वकर्माणि मनसा सन्न्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी.translation: When the embodied living being controls his nature and mentally renounces all actions, he resides happily in the city of nine gates, neither working nor causing work to be done.
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा सन्न्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी.explanation: The self-controlled person lives in peace

न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभु.translation: The embodied spirit, master of the city of his body, does not create activities, nor does he induce people to act, nor does he create the fruits of action. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature.
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभु.explanation: The soul does not act; nature acts

नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः।.translation: Nor does the Supreme Spirit assume anyone's sinful or pious activities. Embodied beings, however, are bewildered because of the ignorance which covers their real knowledge.
नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः।.explanation: The Supreme is unaffected by actions

ज्ञानेन तु तज्ज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः।.translation: When, however, one is enlightened with the knowledge by which nescience is destroyed, then his knowledge reveals everything, as the sun lights up everything in the daytime.
ज्ञानेन तु तज्ज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः।.explanation: Knowledge destroys ignorance like the sun

तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायण.translation: When one's intelligence, mind, faith and refuge are all fixed in the Supreme, then one becomes fully cleansed of misgivings through complete knowledge and thus proceeds straight on the path of liberation.

विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि.translation: The humble sages, by virtue of true knowledge, see with equal vision a learned and gentle brahmana, a cow, an elephant, a dog and a dog-eater.
विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि.explanation: The wise see all beings equally

इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं.translation: Those whose minds are established in sameness and equanimity have already conquered the conditions of birth and death. They are flawless like Brahman, and thus they are already situated in Brahman.

न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्.translation: A person who neither rejoices upon achieving something pleasant nor laments upon obtaining something unpleasant, who is self-intelligent, who is unbewildered, and who knows the science of God, is already situated in transcendence.
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्.explanation: The self-realized remain steady in all situations

बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि.translation: Such a liberated person is not attracted to material sense pleasure but is always in trance, enjoying the pleasure within. In this way the self-realized person enjoys unlimited happiness, for he concentrates on the Supreme.

ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते। आद.translation: An intelligent person does not take part in the sources of misery, which are due to contact with the material senses. O son of Kunti, such pleasures have a beginning and an end, and so the wise person does not delight in them.
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते। आद.explanation: Material pleasures are temporary and lead to misery

शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात.translation: Before giving up this present body, if one is able to tolerate the urges of the material senses and check the force of desire and anger, he is well situated and is happy in this world.
शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात.explanation: Controlling desires and anger brings happiness

योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव.translation: One whose happiness is within, who is active and rejoices within, and whose aim is inward is actually the perfect mystic. He is liberated in the Supreme, and ultimately he attains the Supreme.
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव.explanation: The perfect yogi finds happiness within

लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः।.translation: Those who are beyond the dualities that arise from doubts, whose minds are engaged within, who are always busy working for the welfare of all living beings, and who are free from all sins, achieve liberation in the Supreme.
लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः।.explanation: Working for others' welfare leads to liberation

कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम्। अभ.translation: Those who are free from anger and all material desires, who are self-realized, self-disciplined and constantly endeavoring for perfection, are assured of liberation in the Supreme in the very near future.
कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम्। अभ.explanation: Freedom from anger and desire leads to liberation

स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैव.translation: Shutting out all external sense objects, keeping the eyes and vision concentrated between the two eyebrows, suspending the inward and outward breaths within the nostrils, and thus controlling the mind, senses and intelligence, the transcendentalist becomes free from desire, fear and anger. One who is always in this state is certainly liberated.

मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते। स.translation: A person who accepts the path of devotional service is not bereft of the results derived from studying the Vedas, performing sacrifices, undergoing austerities, giving charity or pursuing philosophical and fruitive activities. Simply by performing devotional service, he attains all these, and at the end he reaches the supreme eternal abode.

मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः.translation: Now hear, O son of Pritha, how by practicing yoga in full consciousness of Me, with mind attached to Me, you can know Me in full, free from doubt.
मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः.explanation: Krishna promises to reveal Himself completely

ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषत.translation: I shall now declare unto you in full this knowledge, both phenomenal and spiritual. This being known, nothing further shall remain for you to know.

मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये।.translation: Out of many thousands among men, one may endeavor for perfection, and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये।.explanation: Very few know the Supreme truth

भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च। अ.translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence and false ego—all together these eight constitute My separated material energies.

अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पर.translation: Besides these, O mighty-armed Arjuna, there is another, superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who are exploiting the resources of this material, inferior nature.

एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय। अहं.translation: All created beings have their source in these two natures. Of all that is material and all that is spiritual in this world, know for certain that I am both the origin and the dissolution.
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय। अहं.explanation: The Supreme is the source and dissolution of all

मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय। म.translation: O conqueror of wealth, there is no truth superior to Me. Everything rests upon Me, as pearls are strung on a thread.
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय। म.explanation: Everything is connected to the Supreme like pearls on a thread

रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः.translation: O son of Kunti, I am the taste of water, the light of the sun and the moon, the syllable Om in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether and ability in man.
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः.explanation: The Supreme manifests in various forms

पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभ.translation: I am the original fragrance of the earth, and I am the heat in fire. I am the life of all that lives, and I am the penances of all ascetics.
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभ.explanation: The Supreme is present in all things

बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम.translation: O son of Pritha, know that I am the original seed of all existences, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the prowess of all powerful men.
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम.explanation: The Supreme is the source of all intelligence and power

बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्। धर्माव.translation: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire. I am sex life which is not contrary to religious principles, O lord of the Bharatas.
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्। धर्माव.explanation: The Supreme is strength without attachment

ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च य.translation: All states of being—be they of goodness, passion or ignorance—are manifested by My energy. I am, in one sense, everything, but I am independent. I am not under the modes of material nature, for they, on the contrary, are within Me.
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च य.explanation: The Supreme is beyond material modes

त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्।.translation: Deluded by the three modes, the whole world does not know Me, who am above the modes and inexhaustible.
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्।.explanation: The world is deluded by material modes

दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया। माम.translation: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who have surrendered unto Me can easily cross beyond it.
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया। माम.explanation: Surrender to the divine overcomes material nature

न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधम.translation: Those miscreants who are grossly foolish, who are lowest among mankind, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the atheistic nature of demons do not surrender unto Me.
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधम.explanation: The deluded do not surrender to the divine

चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन.translation: O best among the Bharatas, four kinds of pious men begin to render devotional service unto Me—the distressed, the desirer of wealth, the inquisitive, and he who is searching for knowledge of the Absolute.
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन.explanation: Four types of people approach the divine

तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्य.translation: Of these, the one who is in full knowledge and who is always engaged in pure devotional service is the best. For I am very dear to him, and he is very dear to Me.
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्य.explanation: The wise devotee is most dear to the Supreme

उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मत.translation: All these devotees are undoubtedly magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me I consider to be just like My own self. Being engaged in My transcendental service, he is sure to attain Me, the highest and most perfect goal.
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मत.explanation: The wise devotee attains the highest goal

बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यत.translation: After many births and deaths, he who is actually in knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes and all that is. Such a great soul is very rare.
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यत.explanation: The rare soul who fully knows the Supreme

कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्य.translation: Those whose intelligence has been stolen by material desires surrender unto demigods and follow the particular rules and regulations of worship according to their own natures.
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्य.explanation: Material desires lead to worship of demigods

यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुम.translation: I am in everyone's heart as the Supersoul. As soon as one desires to worship some demigod, I make his faith steady so that he can devote himself to that particular deity.
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुम.explanation: The Supreme grants faith according to desire

स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते। लभ.translation: Endowed with such a faith, he endeavors to worship a particular demigod and obtains his desires. But in actuality these benefits are bestowed by Me alone.
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते। लभ.explanation: All benefits come from the Supreme alone

अहं ब्रह्मास्मि.explanation: Realization of oneness with the Absolute

असतो मा सद्गमय। तमसो मा ज्योतिर्गमय। मृत.translation: Lead me from the unreal to the real, from darkness to light, from death to immortality

ॐ पूर्णमदः पूर्णमिदं पूर्णात्पूर्णमुदच्य.translation: Om, That is complete, This is complete, From the complete comes the complete

एको देवः सर्वभूतेषु गूढः.translation: The one God hidden in all beings

न तत्र सूर्यो भाति न चन्द्रतारकं.translation: There the sun does not shine, nor the moon and stars
न तत्र सूर्यो भाति न चन्द्रतारकं.explanation: The divine light transcends all lights

यतो वाचो निवर्तन्ते अप्राप्य मनसा सह.translation: From which words turn back, along with the mind, not having reached it

अन्धं तमः प्रविशन्ति येऽविद्यामुपासते.translation: Into blinding darkness enter those who worship ignorance

अणोरणीयान् महतो महीयान्.translation: The Self is smaller than the small, greater than the great

उत्तिष्ठत जाग्रत प्राप्य वरान्निबोधत.translation: Arise, awake, and learn by approaching the wise

आत्मानं रथिनं विद्धि शरीरं रथमेव तु। बुद.translation: Know the Self as the rider in the chariot, and the body as the chariot. Know the intellect as the charioteer, and the mind as the reins
आत्मानं रथिनं विद्धि शरीरं रथमेव तु। बुद.explanation: The chariot analogy of the self

इन्द्रियाणि हयानाहुर्विषयांस्तेषु गोचरान.translation: The senses, they say, are the horses; the objects of sense, what they range over

ॐ सह नाववतु सह नौ भुनक्तु सह वीर्यं करवा.translation: Om, may He protect us both, may He nourish us both, may we acquire strength together
ॐ सह नाववतु सह नौ भुनक्तु सह वीर्यं करवा.explanation: Prayer for mutual protection and nourishment

तेजस्वि नावधीतमस्तु मा विद्विषावहै.translation: May our learning be brilliant, may we not hate each other

ऋग्वेदो यजुर्वेदः सामवेदोऽथर्ववेदः.translation: The Rig Veda, Yajur Veda, Sama Veda, and Atharva Veda

एकं सद्विप्रा बहुधा वदन्ति.translation: The wise speak of the One Truth in many ways

अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवं ऋत्विजम्.translation: I praise Agni, the chosen Priest, God of the sacrifice, the Hotar, lavishest of wealth

मातृदेवो भव। पितृदेवो भव। आचार्यदेवो भव।.translation: Be one to whom mother is a god, be one to whom father is a god, be one to whom teacher is a god

अथातो ब्रह्मजिज्ञासा.translation: Now, therefore, the inquiry into Brahman
अथातो ब्रह्मजिज्ञासा.explanation: Beginning of inquiry into the Absolute

योगश्चित्तवृत्तिनिरोधः.translation: Yoga is the restraint of the modifications of the mind

तदा द्रष्टुः स्वरूपेऽवस्थानम्.translation: Then the seer abides in his own nature

वृत्तिसारूप्यमितरत्र.translation: At other times the seer appears to assume the form of the modifications

अभ्यासवैराग्याभ्यां तन्निरोधः.translation: The restraint is achieved through practice and non-attachment

तत्र स्थितौ यत्नोऽभ्यासः.translation: Practice is the effort to be steady in that state

स तु दीर्घकालनैरन्तर्यसत्कारासेवितो दृढभ.translation: That practice becomes firmly grounded when continued for a long time without interruption and with earnest devotion

दृष्टानुश्रविकविषयवितृष्णस्य वशीकारसंज्ञ.translation: Non-attachment is the mastery of consciousness over its objects, whether seen or heard

तत्परं पुरुषख्यातेर्गुणवैतृष्ण्यम्.translation: The highest non-attachment is the absence of craving for the gunas themselves, which comes from the awareness of Purusha

वितर्कविचारानन्दास्मितारूपानुगमात्संप्रज.translation: Samprajnata samadhi is accompanied by reasoning, reflecting, rejoicing, and pure I-am-ness

विरामप्रत्ययाभ्यासपूर्वः संस्कारशेषोऽन्य.translation: The other kind of samadhi is preceded by the practice of stilling the mind, and leaves only latent impressions

भवप्रत्ययो विदेहप्रकृतिलयानाम्.translation: For those who have merged with nature or become disembodied, samadhi arises from the sense of self

श्रद्धावीर्यस्मृतिसमाधिप्रज्ञापूर्वक इतर.translation: For others, samadhi is preceded by faith, energy, memory, concentration, and discrimination

तीव्रसंवेगानामासन्नः.translation: For those with intense practice, samadhi is near

मृदुमध्याधिमात्रत्वात्ततोऽपि विशेषः.translation: The intensity of practice can be mild, moderate, or intense

क्लेशकर्मविपाकाशयैरपरामृष्टः पुरुषविशेष.translation: Ishvara is a special Purusha, untouched by afflictions, actions, fruits of actions, or their residues

तत्र निरतिशयं सर्वज्ञबीजम्.translation: In Ishvara is the unsurpassed seed of omniscience
तत्र निरतिशयं सर्वज्ञबीजम्.explanation: Ishvara as the source of all knowledge

स एष पूर्वेषामपि गुरुः कालेनानवच्छेदात्.translation: Ishvara is the teacher of even the ancient teachers, being not limited by time

तस्य वाचकः प्रणवः.translation: The word that expresses Ishvara is Om
तस्य वाचकः प्रणवः.explanation: Om as the expression of Ishvara

तज्जपस्तदर्थभावनम्.translation: Repeating it and contemplating its meaning

ततः प्रत्यक्चेतनाधिगमोऽप्यन्तरायाभावश्च.translation: From that comes the realization of the inner consciousness and the removal of obstacles

व्याधिस्त्यानसंशयप्रमादालस्याविरतिभ्रान्.translation: Sickness, mental laziness, doubt, lack of enthusiasm, laziness, sense indulgence, false perception, failure to reach firm ground, and instability are the obstacles to the mind

दुःखदौर्मनस्याङ्गमेजयत्वश्वासप्रश्वासा व.translation: Accompanying these obstacles are distress, despair, trembling of the body, and irregular breathing

तत्प्रतिषेधार्थमेकतत्त्वाभ्यासः.translation: To prevent these obstacles, one should practice concentration on a single principle

मैत्रीकरुणामुदितोपेक्षाणां सुखदुःखपुण्या.translation: By cultivating attitudes of friendliness toward the happy, compassion toward the suffering, joy toward the virtuous, and equanimity toward the non-virtuous, the mind becomes purified

प्रच्छर्दनविधारणाभ्यां वा प्राणस्य.translation: Or through the regulation of the breath

विषयवती वा प्रवृत्तिरुत्पन्ना मनसः स्थित.translation: Or through concentration on a subtle sense perception, the mind becomes steady

विशोका वा ज्योतिष्मती.translation: Or through meditating on the inner light, which is beyond sorrow

वीतरागविषयं वा चित्तम्.translation: Or through contemplating on a mind free from attachment

स्वप्ननिद्राज्ञानालम्बनं वा.translation: Or through meditating on the knowledge that comes in sleep or dream

यथाभिमतध्यानाद्वा.translation: Or through meditation on whatever object one prefers

परमाणुपरममहत्त्वान्तोऽस्य वशीकारः.translation: The mastery of concentration extends from the smallest particle to the greatest infinity

क्षीणवृत्तेरभिजातस्येव मणेर्ग्रहीतृग्रहण.translation: When the modifications of the mind have become weakened, the mind becomes like a transparent crystal, taking the color of whatever is placed near it
क्षीणवृत्तेरभिजातस्येव मणेर्ग्रहीतृग्रहण.explanation: The mind becomes like a crystal

तत्र शब्दार्थज्ञानविकल्पैः संकीर्णा सवित.translation: In that state, when the mind is mixed with word, meaning, and perception, it is called savitarka samapatti

स्मृतिपरिशुद्धौ स्वरूपशून्येवार्थमात्रनि.translation: When memory is purified, the mind appears to be devoid of its own nature and only the object shines forth. This is nirvitarka samapatti

एतयैव सविचारा निर्विचारा च सूक्ष्मविषया.translation: By these same processes, savichara and nirvichara samapattis, which use subtle objects, are also explained

सूक्ष्मविषयत्वं चालिङ्गपर्यवसानम्.translation: The subtle objects extend up to the unmanifest prakriti

ता एव सबीजः समाधिः.translation: These are the only kinds of objective samadhi

निर्विचारवैशारद्येऽध्यात्मप्रसादः.translation: In the clarity of nirvichara samapatti, the inner Self becomes clear

ऋतंभरा तत्र प्रज्ञा.translation: In that state, the knowledge is filled with truth

श्रुतानुमानप्रज्ञाभ्यामन्यविषया विशेषार्.translation: This knowledge is different from that derived from testimony or inference, because it relates to the specific object

तज्जः संस्कारोऽन्यसंस्कारप्रतिबन्धी.translation: The impression created by that knowledge prevents other impressions

तस्यापि निरोधे सर्वनिरोधान्निर्बीजः समाध.translation: When even that impression is restrained, all is restrained, and there is nirbija samadhi
